chapter.title: Working with Workflow Templates
chapter.para: When working with workflows, a distinction is made between workflow templates, workflow instances and workflow activities. Workflow templates are JSON objects that specify the general structure of a workflow. Based on a workflow template, any number of (executable) workflow instances can be created. Workflow activities are linked to a specific workflow instance (for more information on workflow instances, see , for more information on workflow activities, see ).
The following actions are supported for the Workflow Templates view:

sect1.title: Uploading a Workflow Template
sect1.para: You can upload a predefined workflow template as a JSON file. The uploaded JSON file can contain one or more templates.
Follow the steps below to upload a workflow template as a JSON file to the server and display it in the web interface.

step.para: Switch to the Workflow Templates view.

In the navigation bar of the web interface, click Create Button
(Create).

result.para: The Upload Workflow Templates dialog opens.

step.para: Click the Select File button next to the JSON File field.
In the file selection dialog, select the desired JSON file from the directory tree.
In the file selection dialog, click Open to confirm the selection.

result.para: The file selection dialog closes and the name of the selected file is copied to the JSON File field.

step.para: In the Upload Workflow Templates dialog, click the Upload button to upload the selected JSON file to the server.

result.para: The workflow template defined in the JSON file is displayed (or multiple workflow templates are displayed) in the Workflow Templates view.

sect1.title: Listing Workflow Templates
sect1.para: You can display an overview of the workflow templates uploaded to the server in the workspace of the Workflow Templates view.
The overview table displays the following information for each existing workflow template by default:

listitem.para: The unique identifier (sequential number) of the workflow template.
The user-defined name of the process with which the workflow template is connected.
The user-defined name of the workflow template.

The value specifies whether processing within the workflow instances (generated from the workflow template) should be automated or manually controlled. With the default value true individual processing steps are started automatically. With the value false individual steps must be started manually.
Priority of the workflows (generated from the template) within the processing sequence.
Optional description of the workflow template to document special features and distinguishing characteristics.

sect1.title: Displaying Workflow Template Details
sect1.para: If you select a workflow template in the overview table, the information about the selected workflow template is displayed in the details pane. The details pane contains the same scope of information as the overview table.

sect1.title: Filtering Workflow Templates
sect1.para: Use this action to filter the overview of available workflow templates based on the available columns.
Proceed as follows to filter the existing workflow templates and thus reduce the number of displayed workflow templates.

step.para: Switch to the Workflow Templates view.
In the navigation bar of the view, click Filter.
You can filter the existing workflow templates by ID (simple filter) or by other parameters (for more information about filter criteria, see ).

sect1.title: Modifying a Workflow Template
sect1.para: You can edit the workflow template properties.
Proceed as follows to edit the values of an existing workflow template:

step.para: Switch to the Workflow Templates view.
Select the required entry from the overview table.

In the navigation bar of the view, click Button Edit
(Edit).

result.para: The entry switches to editing mode.

step.para: Enter the desired new values in the individual fields or select one of the available values from the dropdown lists.

Click Save button
(Save), to save the changed workflow template and exit the editing mode.

result.para: The editing mode is terminated and the workflow template is displayed with the new values in the overview table.

step.para:
Click Cancel button
(Cancel), to cancel workflow template editing and exit the editing mode without saving the changes.

sect1.title: Editing Multiple Workflow Templates
sect1.para: Use this action to edit selected values for multiple workflow templates in one step.

note.para: Please keep in mind that this function defines the same values for all selected workflow templates.

sect1.para: Proceed as follows to edit the settings of the selected workflow templates.

step.para: Select at least two workflow templates from the overview table.

In the navigation bar of the web interface, click Icon Edit
(Edit).
Tick the checkbox next to each value you want to change for all selected workflow templates.
In each of the selected fields, specify the desired new value for all selected workflow templates
Click OK to save the changed settings for all selected workflow templates and close the dialog.

result.para: The changed settings for the selected workflow templates are displayed in the overview table and in the details pane.

step.para: Click Cancel to close the dialog without changing the settings.

sect1.title: Deleting Workflow Templates
sect1.para: Use this action to delete a workflow template or multiple workflow templates. Proceed as follows to delete existing workflow templates:

step.para: Switch to the Workflow Templates view.
Select at least one workflow template from the overview table.

In the navigation bar of the view, click Button Delete
(Delete).

result.para: The confirmation dialog Delete Workflow Templates opens.

step.para: In the confirmation dialog Delete Workflow Templates, click OK to delete the selected workflow template (or workflow templates).
In the confirmation dialog Delete Workflow Templates, click Cancel to close the dialog without deleting the selected workflow template(s).

result.para: If the workflow templates have been successfully deleted, a success message is displayed.
If the workflow templates could not be deleted, the corresponding error message is displayed.
